iMPS module¶

class iMPS.iMPS(L, d, D, tol=1e-08, pure=True)[source]¶

Infinite Matrix Product State

Description:
Object for representing an Infinite Matrix Product State. Stores the MPS matrices B[i], Lambda[i] and Chi[i] (bond dimension).
Conventions:
Lambda[i] is the bond between site i and i+1.

Methods

getEntEntr()[source]¶

Return the entanglement entropy for each of the bonds

getTensor(site, full=False, form='R')[source]¶

Return MPS tensor for given site. If not full, return only up to current bond dimension.

getTheta(bond)[source]¶

Construct theta for bond

isCanonical(threshold=1e-08)[source]¶

Check if iMPS is in canonical form by checking threshold on each bond.

Parameters: threshold: Sets threshold for what is considered canonical. Defaults to 10^(-8)

classmethod loadFromFile(filename)[source]¶
measure(ops, sites)[source]¶
measure_mixed(ops, sites)[source]¶

Compute expectation value of (list of) operator(s).

Assumes that the isometric gauge is centered on the left-most site, and that all other matrices are right-normalized.

Parameters:

- Ops (numpy array/matrix) or (list of numpy arrays/matrices)

If a single operator is specified, a single site has to be specified. If a list of operators is given, then also an equal length list with different sites has to be given.

  • sites (int) or (list of ints)

    Sites on which corresponding operators act
measure_pure(ops, sites)[source]¶

Compute expectation value of (list of) operator(s).

Assumes that the isometric gauge is centered on the left-most site, and that all other matrices are right-normalized.

Parameters:

- Ops (numpy array/matrix) or (list of numpy arrays/matrices)

If a single operator is specified, a single site has to be specified. If a list of operators is given, then also an equal length list with different sites has to be given.

  • sites (int) or (list of ints)

    Sites on which corresponding operators act
orthogonalize(tol=1e-12, truncate=True)[source]¶

Orthogonalize the whole MPS.

Parameters:
threshold: Threshold up to which the MPS has to be orthogonal.
saveToFile(filename)[source]¶

Save MPS to a file

set_infinite_temperature_state()[source]¶

Set infinite temperature state - only for non-pure!

set_product_state(state=None)[source]¶

Set a product state

set_random_state(ortho=True)[source]¶

Set the state of the MPS to a random one

swap(bond)[source]¶

Swap sites connected by bond.
